heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 03 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (191°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: Weather's been pretty steady overall — nothing much to report.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, humidity should not be a concern and winds will be practically absent. A few light raindrops may fall, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and bright intervals likely. The weather will likely remain the same.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
